title: Martin Buber - Religious & Philosophical Works (23 books)
description:
* * This is a revised and enlarged version of an earlier torrent * *


MARTIN BUBER (1878-1965) was an Austrian-born Jewish philosopher and one of the paramount spiritual leaders of the twentieth century.  He is best known for his philosophy of dialogue, a form of existentialism centered on the distinction between the I-Thou relationship and the I-It relationship.

Buber's appeal is vast -- not only is he renowned for his translations of the Hebrew Bible but also for his interpretation of Hasidism, his role in Zionism, and his writings in psychotherapy and political philosophy.


The following books are in PDF format unless otherwise indicated:

* BETWEEN MAN AND MAN (Routledge Classics, 2002).  Translated by Ronald Gregor-Smith, with an introduction by Maurice Friedman.

* ECLIPSE OF GOD: Studies in the Relation Between Religion and Philosophy (Harper & Row, 1952).  Scanned by and reproduced with the kind permission of @pharmakate.

* ENCOUNTER: Autobiographical Fragments (Open Court, 1967).

* GOOD AND EVIL (Scribners, 1953).  Translated by Ronald Gregor Smith and Michael Bullock.

* I AND THOU: A New Translation with a Prologue "I and You" and Notes (Scribners, 1970).  Translated by Walter Kaufmann.  Scanned by and reproduced with the kind permission of @pharmakate.

* I AND THOU (Scribners, 1958).  Second edition.  Translated by Ronald Gregor Smith.

* ISRAEL AND THE WORLD: Essays in a Time of Crisis (Schocken, 1963).  Second edition.

* THE LEGEND OF THE BAAL-SHEM (Routledge, 2002).  Translated by Maurice Friedman.

* THE LETTERS OF MARTIN BUBER: A Life of Dialogue (Schocken, 1991).  Edited by Nahum N. Glatzer and Paul Mendes-Flohr; translated by Richard Winston, Clara Winston, and Harry Zohn. -- ePUB

* MEETINGS: Autobiographical Fragments (Routledge, 2002).  Edited and introduced by Maurice Friedman.

* MOSES: The Revelation and the Covenant (Harper & Bros., 1946).  Scanned by and reproduced with the kind permission of @pharmakate.

* ON JUDAISM (Schocken, 1995).  Edited by Nahum N. Glatzer, with a Foreword by Rodger Kamenetz. -- ePUB

* ON THE BIBLE: Eighteen Studies (Schocken, 1968).  Edited by Nahum N. Glatzer.

* THE ORIGIN AND MEANING OF HASIDISM (Harper & Row, 1960).  Edited and translated by Maurice Friedman.

* PATHS IN UTOPIA (Beacon, 1958).  Translated by R. F. C. Hull.

* POINTING THE WAY: Collected Essays (Harper & Bros., 1957).  Translated and edited by Maurice Friedman.

* THE PROPHETIC FAITH (Harper & Row, 1960).  Translated by Carlyle Witton-Davies.

* TALES OF THE HASIDISM [one-volume edition] (Schocken, 1991).  With a new Foreword by Chaim Potok. -- ePUB

* TALES OF THE HASIDIM: Volume 2: The Later Masters (Schocken, 1948).

* TEN RUNGS: Collected Hasidic Sayings (Routledge, 2002).  Translated by Olga Marx.

* TWO TYPES OF FAITH (Macmillan, 1951).  Translated by Norman P. Goldhawk.

* THE WAY OF MAN: According to the Teaching of Hasidism (Citadel, 1995).  

* THE WRITINGS OF MARTIN BUBER (Meridian, 1956).  Selected, edited and introduced by Will Herberg
